title.rendered: Recommendations to avoid scams and money loss in cryptocurrency projects, NFTs and metaverses

content.rendered:
In recent months there has been a boom in the supply of crypto assets and virtual assets such as the so-called NFTs. Photo Pixabay

These last 12 months have been of constant growth in the universe of cryptocurrencies. Many new projects have emerged, countless collections of NFTs and new spaces under the name of the metaverse have gained relevance and a prominent place in news portals around the world. However, this scenario has also given rise to the number of people who have suffered some type of scam grows, that have lost their investment due to ignorance or lack of education.

As a general rule, the first purchase of cryptocurrency that a person makes is by recommendation. Whether it is because you read it on the Internet or it was the topic of conversation at the last family gathering, the truth is that this has great weight when making investment decisions and is also usually the first big mistake in the crypto universe.

The importance of knowing the project

An analogy that always explains well the importance of knowing and studying blockchain projects is by comparing it to a political party or a candidate.

Before casting their vote, a person previously studied their candidate and analyzed whether the proposal they have meets their needs or believes that it can benefit the community where they live. In general, they go on election day with a clear idea of ​​what the political option they are going to choose offers, it is not an impulse or recommendation from the neighbor. The same goes for cryptocurrencies, NFTs and metaverses.

Everything is in the Whitepaper and Roadmap

Any serious project, for example a play2earnhas an official website where you can consult, in detail, what are the actions to be taken by the development team to grow the game. On the other hand, you have a roadmap showing a timeline to visualize when the improvements will be applied throughout the next few months.

Let’s imagine that we are in the year 2009 and that we have heard of something called Bitcoin (BTC/USD) but we are not sure what it is. We could go on the internet, access your official website and read the white paper you wrote. Satoshi Nakamoto to explain the whole project.

Developers and partners

Last but not least, You have to know who are the people behind the projects and which are the companies that have invested capital in its development.

On the same web page, there is a section where these two lists are shown and you can even consult the social networks of the team involved.

It is important to know their interaction with the community, if they constantly talk about the project or how they are involved.

As usual, the most important thing is to invest time in getting to know the project before making the decision to invest in it.
